results.snippet: With aging, there are fewer and fewer people familiar with the culture that is yours. If you age a lot, there is finally almost nobody left who shares your vast experience of an incredibly fascinating world.    Your exclusive experience of this...
results.lead_paragraph: With aging, there are fewer and fewer people familiar with the culture that is yours. If you age a lot, there is finally almost nobody left who shares your vast experience of an incredibly fascinating world. Your exclusive experience of this broad culture, in fact, may make you slightly absurd and will almost certainly make you tiresome if you refuse to keep quiet about it. Thus, people born in the age of the "It" girl found it hilarious that their elders wore high-button shoes.

headline.main: SOVIET TURMOIL: Reporter's Notebook; From Soviet Space Station: Queries on State of the Union

results.snippet: The astronauts aboard the Soviet space station Mir, having journeyed weightless for the past 18 days above coup, counter-coup and constitutional crisis, beamed down an urgent question today about just how much political disintegration has been...
results.lead_paragraph: The astronauts aboard the Soviet space station Mir, having journeyed weightless for the past 18 days above coup, counter-coup and constitutional crisis, beamed down an urgent question today about just how much political disintegration has been taking place below them. "Is it true that the Russian federation plans to sell the space station Mir?" one astronaut asked the home office. He was rocketed aloft four months ago, when the Soviet Union was really something and even included the three Baltic republics.

headline.main: Sketches of the 5 Astronauts Aboard the Shuttle Discovery

results.snippet: John O. Creighton:    Mission Commander     Captain Creighton, a 48-year-old Navy pilot, made his first trip into space six years ago as the pilot of the shuttle Discovery.
results.lead_paragraph: John O. Creighton: Mission Commander Captain Creighton, a 48-year-old Navy pilot, made his first trip into space six years ago as the pilot of the shuttle Discovery.

headline.main: At Work, at Play, at War, Headgear for Our Times

results.snippet: Armor produced over the last century is often as terrifying and magical as it is technologically sophisticated. In the exhibition "Modern Masks and Helmets," at the Museum of Modern Art through Nov. 19, many of the head protectors from the Space...
results.lead_paragraph: Armor produced over the last century is often as terrifying and magical as it is technologically sophisticated. In the exhibition "Modern Masks and Helmets," at the Museum of Modern Art through Nov. 19, many of the head protectors from the Space Age and earlier are imbued with symbolism as powerful as any found in tribal cultures. The show of 40 examples of headgear made between 1850 and 1990, to be worn at work, play and on the battlefield, is the first museum survey of such modern armor, according to Cara McCarty, an associate curator in the museum's department of architecture and design. Miss McCarty selected colorful and visually arresting artifacts, solutions to society's fear of nuclear warfare, terrorism, hazardous wastes as well as the dangers posed by competitive sports.

results.snippet: * Delmarva Power and Light Co., Wilmington, Del., an electricity and gas company, named Howard E. Cosgrove president and chief operating officer, succeeding Nevius M. Curtis. Mr. Curtis, who remains chairman and chief executive, said he plans to...
results.lead_paragraph: * Delmarva Power and Light Co., Wilmington, Del., an electricity and gas company, named Howard E. Cosgrove president and chief operating officer, succeeding Nevius M. Curtis. Mr. Curtis, who remains chairman and chief executive, said he plans to retire in the second half of 1992. * General Mills Inc., Minneapolis, appointed Michael A. Peel senior vice president-personnel.

results.snippet: A 'Doors' Nay-Sayer    Now and then the real-life subjects of movies don't like the way they come across on screen. "Oliver Stone has missed the whole point of the Doors," said Ray Manzarek during a recent conversation. "He made Jim Morrison a...
results.lead_paragraph: A 'Doors' Nay-Sayer Now and then the real-life subjects of movies don't like the way they come across on screen. "Oliver Stone has missed the whole point of the Doors," said Ray Manzarek during a recent conversation. "He made Jim Morrison a drunk and a jerk and reduced the Doors to a peripheral place in the story." The keyboardist of the 60's group, Mr. Manzarek said he liked nothing about Mr. Stone's film "The Doors" (released today by LIVE), including the depiction of himself by Kyle MacLachlan. "It was wooden," he said.
